title.rendered: Why is the status of my listing marked ‘Insufficient’ or ‘Rejected’?

content.rendered:
If your listing is in ‘Insufficient’ or ‘Rejected’ status, you’ll receive an in-app message from our Listings Team letting you know what needs to be completed to get your room listing up and running.Common reasons for ‘Insufficient’ or ‘Rejected’ status:

  • We need to verify your residency at the address listed
  • The listing doesn’t have any interior photos or they are blurry
  • You don’t have a profile photo

As soon as we receive the requested information from you, we’ll have your listing up and running in no time! If you believe you did not receive an in-app message with this information, you may contact Roomi Support.

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I edit my listing?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: If you need to adjust your rent price, amenities, roommate preferences, or any other changes, please follow the steps below to edit your listing: Web Login to your Roomi account and click My ListingsYour listing may appear under the Active, Inactive, or Incomplete tab depending on its status. Click the…

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I create a listing on Roomi?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: You can make use of your two free credits to create two free listings on your Roomi account to post your available room or rooms for rent on Roomi. You must be in Lister Mode to post a listing.  Please reference our Help Center article, 'How do I switch between…

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I deactivate my listing?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Deactivating your listing will take it out of the search results while giving you the option to re-activate it at a later time. As soon as the listing is deactivated you will need a listing credit in order to reactivate it. When you reactivate your listing you will need to…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Does my listing ever expire?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Your listing will expire a month after the move-in date you selected when you created your listing. We'll send you an email to ask if your room is still available three weeks after your move-in date. You can change the move-in date at any time by editing your room listing…

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I boost my listing?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We offer the option to boost your listing if you need to fill your room quickly. This feature pushes your listing to the top of the search page in your area, enabling users to see your room first when searching for a place. Listing Boosts are non-refundable Web Login to…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Why do my listings keep getting deactivated?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Whenever certain changes are done to your listing after it was first published such as (changing location, move-in date, photos, and so on) your listing will go back to pending and it will be re-approved making use of one listing credit. Please be advised that you will need to have…
